text: hey guys it's angel I'm here in LA
visiting my friend Olivia from love
health okay
hey guys and Angel and I said it would
be really fun to do some a Chinese New
Year dessert recipes because they're our
favorites and we wanted to share them
you guys since trend here is coming up
so in this video we're going to be
meeting changing all my cookies which
I'm super excited about and on my
channel we're going to be making some
tapioca pudding and it's completely
healthy with only four ingredients and
one of them is actually a secret
ingredient so don't forget to check out
Olivia's video in the video description
below and let's get started first let's
start with the ingredients in a large
mixing bowls start with your dry
ingredients we'll need one and a quarter
cups of all purpose flour 3/4 cups of
cane sugar two tablespoons of dried
powder milk three quarters of a teaspoon
of baking powder and three quarters of a
teaspoon of salt stir and mix all those
ingredients together first then add your
wet ingredients we'll need one teaspoon
of almond extract which will smell so
good in your kitchen half an egg whisk
leaving the other half for our egg wash
and finally half a cup of softened
unsalted butter mix all those
ingredients together to form a dough and
sometimes it helps just to dig in and
use your hands for this part
next form your dough into a rectangle
shape and place it on a sheet of plastic
wrap and let it chill now it's super
important to let the dough chill in the
fridge or freezer so it holds its shape
and doesn't spread when baking the
cookies after that divide the dough into
12 equal pieces as this recipe makes a
dozen almond cookies and don't worry if
it's hard to cut it should be like
cutting cold butter then roll each piece
into a ball and continue doing this
until you have all 12 made next place
the cookies on a cookie sheet and with
the palm of your hand gently press down
to flatten the cookie then grab a fork
and make a crisscross indentation on top
like this and don't worry about it being
perfect that's what makes it homemade
finally with the remaining half of your
egg add a splash of water or milk to
make an egg wash and brush over the top
of the cookies then optional but
recommended take one or two sliced
almonds and gently press them into the
center repeat this step for all cookies
and bake in a preheated oven at 350
degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until
golden brown
let the cookies cool on a cooling rack
before serving and enjoy so that's how
easy it is to make these Chinese almond
cookies if you guys enjoyed it ensure
you give this video a thumbs up and also
a comment below and let us know if you
do make these cookies because you must
know that and don't forget to check out
Olivia Channel she's making four
ingredient tapioca pudding with a secret
ingredient that you guys gotta find out
so make sure you click the link in the
description box below and let us see
some veggies I mean one for you
you have cookie
